001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import java.util.*;
004import java.util.function.Function;
005import java.util.stream.Collector;
006import java.util.stream.Collectors;
007
008/**
009 * A factory of {@link Collector}s that allows to collect the stream of values into linked or sorted sets
010 * and the stream of {@link Map.Entry entries} and any other types into the linked or the sorted map.
011 * An enumeration {@link MergeFunction} could be used to handle the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key}.
012 */
013public class CoreCollectors {
014
015    /**
016     * The same as {@link Collectors#toList()}, but tp collect the items in <b>reverse order</b>.
017     *
018     * @return a {@code Collector} which collects all the input elements into an {@link ArrayList} in <b>reverse order</b>.
019     * @param <T> the type of the elements in stream to collect
020     */
021    public static <T> Collector<T, ?, ArrayList<T>> toListReversed() {
022        return Collector.of(
023            ArrayList::new,
024            ArrayList::addFirst,
025            (left, right) -> {
026                right.addAll(0, left);
027                return right;
028            }
029        );
030    }
031
032    /**
033     * The same as {@link Collectors#toCollection JDK's toCollection(...)}, but produces {@link LinkedList}.
034     *
035     * @return a {@code Collector} which collects all the input elements into a {@link LinkedList}.
036     * @param <T> the type of the elements in stream to collect
037     */
038    public static <T> Collector<T, ?, List<T>> toLinkedList() {
039        return Collectors.toCollection(LinkedList::new);
040    }
041
042    /**
043     * The same as {@link #toLinkedList()}, but collecting the items in <b>reverse order</b>.
044     *
045     * @return a {@code Collector} which collects all the input elements into a {@link LinkedList} in <b>reverse order</b>.
046     * @param <T> the type of the elements in stream to collect
047     */
048    public static <T> Collector<T, ?, LinkedList<T>> toLinkedListReversed() {
049        return Collector.of(
050            LinkedList::new,
051            LinkedList::addFirst,
052            (left, right) -> {
053                right.addAll(0, left);
054                return right;
055            }
056        );
057    }
058
059    /**
060     * The same as {@link Collectors#toCollection JDK's toCollection(...)}, but produces {@link ArrayDeque}.
061     *
062     * @return a {@code Collector} which collects all the input elements into a {@link ArrayDeque}.
063     * @param <T> the type of the elements in stream to collect
064     */
065    public static <T> Collector<T, ?, Deque<T>> toDeque() {
066        return Collectors.toCollection(ArrayDeque::new);
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * The same as {@link #toDeque()}, but collecting the items in <b>reverse order</b>.
071     *
072     * @return a {@code Collector} which collects all the input elements into a {@link ArrayDeque} in <b>reverse order</b>.
073     * @param <T> the type of the elements in stream to collect
074     */
075    public static <T> Collector<T, ?, Deque<T>> toDequeReversed() {
076        return Collector.of(
077            ArrayDeque::new,
078            Deque::addFirst,
079            (left, right) -> {
080                right.addAll(left);
081                return right;
082            }
083        );
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * The same as {@link Collectors#toCollection JDK's toCollection(...)}, but produces {@link LinkedHashSet}.
088     *
089     * @return a {@code Collector} which collects all the input elements into a {@link LinkedHashSet}.
090     * @param <T> the type of the elements in stream to collect
091     */
092    public static <T> Collector<T, ?, SequencedSet<T>> toLinkedSet() {
093        return Collectors.toCollection(LinkedHashSet::new);
094    }
095
096    /**
097     * The same as {@link Collectors#toCollection JDK's toCollection(...)}, but produces {@link TreeSet}.
098     *
099     * @return a {@link Collector}, which collects all the input elements into a {@link TreeSet}
100     * @param <T> the type of the elements in stream to collect (must implement {@link Comparable})
101     */
102    public static <T extends Comparable<T>> Collector<T, ?, NavigableSet<T>> toSortedSet() {
103        return Collectors.toCollection(TreeSet::new);
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * The same as {@link #toSortedSet() toSortedSet()}, but with {@code comparator} as parameter
108     *
109     * @param comparator a function to compare the elements
110     * @return  a {@link Collector}, which collects all the input elements into a {@link TreeSet}
111     * @param <T> the type of the elements in stream to collect (not necessary to implement {@link Comparable})
112     */
113    public static <T> Collector<T, ?, NavigableSet<T>>
114    toSortedSet(Comparator<T> comparator) {
115        return Collectors.toCollection(() -> new TreeSet<>(Objects.requireNonNull(comparator)));
116    }
117
118    /**
119     * The same as {@link Collectors#toMap JDK's toMap(...)}, but the elements of collecting stream are required to be
120     * of type {@link Map.Entry}, and the produced sorted-map accepts them one by one like
121     * if the method {@link Map#putAll} would be invoked (the latest entries overwrite the existing ones).
122     *
123     * @return a {@link Collector}, which collects all the input elements into a {@link TreeMap}
124     * @param <K> the type of {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} for {@link Map.Entry entries} in input stream
125     * @param <U> the type of {@link Map.Entry#getValue() value} for {@link Map.Entry entries} in input stream
126     */
127    public static <K, U>
128    Collector<Map.Entry<K,U>, ?, NavigableMap<K,U>>
129    toSortedMap() {
130        return toSortedMap(Map.Entry::getKey, Map.Entry::getValue);
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * The same as {@link #toSortedMap() toSortedMap()}, but the parameter {@code valueMapper} allows to transform
135     * <b>the whole input entry</b> of type {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;K,V&gt;}
136     * into <b>the value of output entry</b> of type {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;K,U&gt;},
137     * and the {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} of input entry remains the same in output one.
138     * <hr/>
139     * <i>the brief summary is:</i><ul>
140     *     <li>{@code valueMapper} function accepts {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;K,V&gt;} and returns {@code <U>}</li>
141     * </ul>
142     *
143     * @param valueMapper the function to transform the {@link Map.Entry#getValue() value}
144     * @return a {@link Collector} that which collects all the input elements into a {@link TreeMap}
145     * @param <K> the type of {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} for {@link Map.Entry entries} in input and output streams
146     * @param <V> the type of {@link Map.Entry#getValue() value} for {@link Map.Entry entries} in output stream
147     * @param <U> the type of {@link Map.Entry#getValue() value} for {@link Map.Entry entries} in input stream
148     */
149    public static <K, V, U>
150    Collector<Map.Entry<K, V>, ?, NavigableMap<K,U>>
151    toSortedMap(Function<Map.Entry<K, V>, U> valueMapper) {
152        return toSortedMap(Map.Entry::getKey, valueMapper);
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * The same as {@link Collectors#toMap JDK's toMap(...)}, but produces {@link TreeMap} with overwriting the duplicates.
157     * <hr/>
158     * <i>the brief summary is:</i><ul>
159     *     <li>{@code keyMapper} function accepts {@code <T>} and returns the type of entry-key {@code <K>}</li>
160     *     <li>{@code valueMapper} function accepts {@code <T>} and returns the type of entry-value {@code <U>}</li>
161     * </ul>
162     *
163     * @param keyMapper a <i>key-mapping</i> function to produce keys
164     * @param valueMapper a <i>value-mapping</i> function to produce values
165     * @return a {@link Collector} that collects elements into a {@link NavigableMap},
166     * whose keys are the result of applying a {@code keyMapper} function to the input elements,
167     * and whose values are the result of applying a {@code valueMapper} function to all input elements
168     * equal to the key and overwriting the existing values with new ones
169     * (according to {@link MergeFunction#OVERWRITE enum-value OVERWRITE}).
170     * @param <T> the type of the input elements
171     * @param <K> the output type of the <i>key-mapping</i> function
172     * @param <U> the output type of the <i>value-mapping</i> function
173     */
174    public static <T, K, U>
175    Collector<T, ?, NavigableMap<K,U>>
176    toSortedMap(Function<? super T, ? extends K> keyMapper,
177                Function<? super T, ? extends U> valueMapper) {
178        return toSortedMap(keyMapper, valueMapper, MergeFunction.OVERWRITE);
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * The same as {@link #toSortedMap(Function, Function) toSortedMap(keyMapper,valueMapper)},
183     * but allows to handle duplicates with {@link MergeFunction mergeFunction} parameter.
184     * <hr/>
185     * <i>the brief summary is:</i><ul>
186     *     <li>{@code keyMapper} function accepts {@code <T>} and returns the type of entry-key {@code <K>}</li>
187     *     <li>{@code valueMapper} function accepts {@code <T>} and returns the type of entry-value {@code <U>}</li>
188     * </ul>
189     *
190     * @param <T> the type of the input elements
191     * @param <K> the output type of the <i>key-mapping</i> function
192     * @param <U> the output type of the <i>value-mapping</i> function
193     * @param keyMapper a <i>key-mapping</i> function to produce keys
194     * @param valueMapper a <i>value-mapping</i> function to produce values
195     * @param mergeFunction one of values that are represented by {@link MergeFunction}-enum
196     * @return a {@link Collector}, that collects elements into a {@link TreeMap},
197     * whose keys are the result of applying a {@code keyMapper} function to the input elements,
198     * and whose values are the result of applying a {@code valueMapper} function to all input elements
199     * equal to the key and combining them using the {@code mergeFunction}.
200     */
201    public static <T, K, U>
202    Collector<T, ?, NavigableMap<K,U>>
203    toSortedMap(Function<? super T, ? extends K> keyMapper,
204                Function<? super T, ? extends U> valueMapper,
205                MergeFunction mergeFunction) {
206        return Collectors.toMap(keyMapper, valueMapper, mergeFunction.op(), TreeMap::new);
207    }
208
209    /**
210     * The same as {@link Collectors#toMap JDK's toMap(...)}, but the elements of collecting stream are required to be
211     * of type {@link Map.Entry}, and the produced linked-map accepts them one by one like
212     * if the method {@link Map#putAll} would be invoked (the latest entries overwrite the existing ones).
213     *
214     * @return a {@link Collector}, which collects all the input elements into a {@link LinkedHashMap}
215     * @param <K> the type of {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} for {@link Map.Entry entries} in input stream
216     * @param <U> the type of {@link Map.Entry#getValue() value} for {@link Map.Entry entries} in input stream
217     */
218    public static <K, U>
219    Collector<Map.Entry<K,U>, ?, SequencedMap<K,U>>
220    toLinkedMap() {
221        return toLinkedMap(Map.Entry::getKey, Map.Entry::getValue);
222    }
223
224    /**
225     * The same as {@link Collectors#toMap JDK's toMap(...)}, but produces {@link LinkedHashMap} with overwriting the duplicates.
226     * <hr/>
227     * <i>the brief summary is:</i><ul>
228     *     <li>{@code keyMapper} function accepts {@code <T>} and returns the type of entry-key {@code <K>}</li>
229     *     <li>{@code valueMapper} function accepts {@code <T>} and returns the type of entry-value {@code <U>}</li>
230     * </ul>
231     *
232     * @param <T> the type of the input elements
233     * @param <K> the output type of the <i>key-mapping</i>  function
234     * @param <U> the output type of the <i>value-mapping</i> function
235     * @param keyMapper a <i>key-mapping</i> function to produce keys
236     * @param valueMapper a <i>value-mapping</i> function to produce values
237     * @return a {@link Collector} that collects elements into a {@link LinkedHashMap},
238     * whose keys are the result of applying a {@code keyMapper} function to the input elements,
239     * and whose values are the result of applying a {@code valueMapper} function to all input elements
240     * equal to the key and overwriting the existing values with new ones
241     * (according to {@link MergeFunction#OVERWRITE enum-value OVERWRITE}).
242     */
243    public static <T, K, U>
244    Collector<T, ?, SequencedMap<K,U>>
245    toLinkedMap(Function<? super T, ? extends K> keyMapper,
246                Function<? super T, ? extends U> valueMapper) {
247        return toLinkedMap(keyMapper, valueMapper, MergeFunction.OVERWRITE);
248    }
249
250    /**
251     * The same as {@link #toLinkedMap(Function, Function) toLinkedMap(keyMapper,valueMapper)},
252     * but allows to handle duplicates with {@link MergeFunction mergeFunction} parameter.
253     * <hr/>
254     * <i>the brief summary is:</i><ul>
255     *     <li>{@code keyMapper} function accepts {@code <T>} and returns the type of entry-key {@code <K>}</li>
256     *     <li>{@code valueMapper} function accepts {@code <T>} and returns the type of entry-value {@code <U>}</li>
257     * </ul>
258     *
259     * @param <T> the type of the input elements
260     * @param <K> the output type of the <i>key-mapping</i>  function
261     * @param <U> the output type of the <i>value-mapping</i> function
262     * @param keyMapper a <i>key-mapping</i> function to produce keys
263     * @param valueMapper a <i>value-mapping</i> function to produce values
264     * @param mergeFunction one of values that are represented by {@link MergeFunction}-enum
265     * @return a {@link Collector} that collects elements into a {@link LinkedHashMap},
266     * whose keys are the result of applying a {@code keyMapper} function to the input elements,
267     * and whose values are the result of applying a {@code valueMapper} function to all input elements
268     * equal to the key and combining them using the {@code mergeFunction}.
269     */
270    public static <T, K, U>
271    Collector<T, ?, SequencedMap<K,U>>
272    toLinkedMap(Function<? super T, ? extends K> keyMapper,
273                Function<? super T, ? extends U> valueMapper,
274                MergeFunction mergeFunction) {
275        return Collectors.toMap(keyMapper, valueMapper, mergeFunction.op(), LinkedHashMap::new);
276    }
277
278    // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
279
280    private CoreCollectors() {
281        // prohibit the creation of utility-class instance
282        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot instantiate utility-class " + getClass().getName());
283    }
284}
